meanings.definition: To spring or swoop suddenly in attack or capture.
meanings.sent1: The cat pounced on the mouse.
meanings.sent2: The lion pounced on its prey in the jungle.
meanings.sent3: The ninja pounced on the opportunity to showcase his skills.
meanings.sent4: The idea pounced on her mind like a lightning bolt.
meanings.sent5: The detective pounced on the clue, unraveling the mystery.

meanings.sent1: She pounced on the chance to try the new dessert.
meanings.sent2: The kids pounced on the candy as soon as it was opened.
meanings.sent3: The shoppers pounced on the sale items, grabbing everything in sight.
meanings.sent4: His words pounced on her heart, leaving her speechless.
meanings.sent5: The opportunity pounced on him unexpectedly, changing his life forever.
